setup.title: Initial Setup
setup.subtitle: How do I set it up from scratch?
setup.description: The step-by-step process I follow to start any Next.js project with Tailwind + shadcn/ui already configured and ready to go.

steps.title: Create the project with Next.js
steps.description: I use create-next-app with TypeScript, Tailwind, and App Router already enabled by default.

steps.title: Initialize shadcn/ui
steps.description: The shadcn CLI configures everything automatically: paths, tokens, CSS variables, and the components/ui folder.

steps.title: Add components as needed
steps.description: I never install everything at once. I only add what the project needs.
steps.code: npx shadcn@latest add button card input dialog npx shadcn@latest add table form select textarea

steps.title: Configure the non-globals.css theme
steps.description: I customize the theme's CSS variables (colors, radius, fonts) directly in globals.css. This ensures consistency throughout the project.

patterns.title: Standards I Follow
patterns.subtitle: Conventions that keep the code clean

items.title: Composition instead of giant props
items.description: I prefer to compose smaller components rather than create one with 20 props. It's more readable, testable, and easier to maintain.
items.code:
// Ruim: <Card title="..." subtitle="..." icon="..." badge="..." /> // Bom: <Card> <CardHeader> <CardTitle>Titulo</CardTitle> <CardDescription>Subtitulo</CardDescription> </CardHeader> <CardContent>...</CardContent>
</Card>

items.title: cn() for conditional classes
items.description: I use the cn() helper (clsx + twMerge) to combine classes safely, without conflict between Tailwind classes.

items.title: Semantic tokens instead of hardcoded colors
items.description: I never use bg-white or text-gray-500 directly. I always use semantic tokens (bg-background, text-muted-foreground) to ensure that dark mode works.
items.code: // Ruim: <div className="bg-white text-gray-900 border-gray-200"> // Bom: <div className="bg-background text-foreground border-border">

items.title: Mobile-first responsive
items.description: I always start with mobile and work my way up. Tailwind makes this much easier with the prefixes md: and lg:.

tips.title: Do vs Don't
tips.subtitle: Common mistakes I see in projects

items.title: Spacing
items.explanation: Use the Tailwind scale. Arbitrary values clutter the code and break spacing consistency.

items.title: Colors
items.explanation: Semantic tokens automatically adapt to the theme. Never hardcode colors.

items.title: Layout
items.explanation: Flexbox resolve 90% dos layouts. Reserve absolute/fixed pra overlays e tooltips.

items.title: Spacing between children
items.explanation: Gap is more predictable and does not conflict with the margin of child components.
